chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall P : Prop, {~ ~ P} + {~ P}

Premises:
Bool.reflect_dec : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> {P} + {~ P}
ssrbool.decidable = fun P : Prop => {P} + {~ P} : Prop -> Set Argument scope is [type_scope]
decide_right : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), ~ C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : ~ C, P (right H)) -> P decide
decide_left : forall (C : Prop) (decide : {C} + {~ C}), C -> forall P : {C} + {~ C} -> Prop, (forall H : C, P (left H)) -> P decide
List.Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {List.Forall P l} + {~ List.Forall P l}
List.Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> {List.Exists P l} + {~ List.Exists P l}
List.Forall_Exists_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {List.Forall P l} + {List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l}
List.neg_Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> ~ List.Forall P l -> List.Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l
ssrbool.classicP : forall P : Prop, ssrbool.classically P < -> ~ ~ P
Decidable.not_not : forall P : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> ~ ~ P -> P
Classical_Prop.classic : forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P
Zodd_dec : forall n : Z, {Zodd n} + {~ Zodd n}
LPO_notnotexists : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> ~ ~ (exists n : nat, P n) -> exists n : nat, P n
LPO_notforall : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> ~ (forall n : nat, ~ P n) -> exists n : nat, P n
SetoidList.InA_dec : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, {eqA x y} + {~ eqA x y}) -> forall (x : A) (l : list A), {SetoidList.InA eqA x l} + {~ SetoidList.InA eqA x l}
Z_ge_dec : forall x y : Z, {(x >= y)%Z} + {~ (x >= y)%Z}
le_dec : forall n m : nat, {(n <= m)%nat} + {~ (n <= m)%nat}
Z_le_dec : forall x y : Z, {(x <= y)%Z} + {~ (x <= y)%Z}
Rle_dec : forall r1 r2 : R, {r1 <= r2} + {~ r1 <= r2}
Znumtheory.Zdivide_dec : forall a b : Z, {(a | b)%Z} + {~ (a | b)%Z}
Rlt_dec : forall r1 r2 : R, {r1 < r2} + {~ r1 < r2}
Z_gt_dec : forall x y : Z, {(x > y)%Z} + {~ (x > y)%Z}
lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {(n < m)%nat} + {~ (n < m)%nat}
Ratan.in_int : forall x : R, {-1 <= x <= 1} + {~ -1 <= x <= 1}
List.in_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (a : A) (l : list A), {List.In a l} + {~ List.In a l}
Classical_Prop.NNPP : forall p : Prop, ~ ~ p -> p
ClassicalFacts.weak_excluded_middle = forall A : Prop, ~ ~ A \/ ~ A : Prop
ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.MP.Dec.FSetLogicalFacts.test_pull : forall P Q R : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> Decidable.decidable Q -> ~ True -> ~ False -> ~ ~ P -> (~ (P /\ Q) -> ~ R) -> P /\ Q \/ ~ R -> ~ (P /\ Q) \/ R -> R \/ ~ (P /\ Q) -> ~ R \/ P /\ Q -> (~ P -> R) -> ~ (R -> P) /\ ~ (Q -> R) -> ~ P \/ ~ R -> P /\ ~ R -> ~ R /\ P -> True
ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.MP.Dec.FSetLogicalFacts.test_push : forall P Q R : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> Decidable.decidable Q -> ~ True -> ~ False -> ~ ~ P -> (~ (P /\ Q) -> ~ R) -> P /\ Q \/ ~ R -> ~ (P /\ Q) \/ R -> R \/ ~ (P /\ Q) -> ~ R \/ P /\ Q -> (~ P -> R) -> ~ ((R -> P) \/ (Q -> R)) -> ~ (P /\ R) -> ~ (P -> R) -> True
ClassicalFacts.wp2p2 : forall (or : Prop -> Prop -> Prop) (or_introl : forall A B : Prop, A -> or A B) (or_intror : forall A B : Prop, B -> or A B) (or_elim : forall A B C : Prop, (A -> C) -> (B -> C) -> or A B -> C), (forall (A B C : Prop) (f : A -> C) (g : B -> C) (b : B), g b = or_elim A B C f g (or_intror A B b)) -> (forall (A B : Prop) (P : or A B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (or_introl A B a)) -> (forall b : B, P (or_intror A B b)) -> forall b : or A B, P b) ->...-> Hurkens.NoRetractToNegativeProp.El A
